plugins.name: SpeX - Design to Code by AI
plugins.description:
SpeX ‚Äì Design to Code by AI


Transform your Figma components into AI-readable specs for seamless design-to-code automation.


üîç What is SpeX?

SpeX bridges design and development by exporting structured specifications from Figma‚Äîenabling AI tools like Cursor and GitHub Copilot to generate accurate, production-grade UI code that aligns with your actual components.


üéØ Who It's For

  1. Design system teams scaling reusable components
  2. Developers using AI coding assistants
  3. Product teams aiming for consistent handoffs
  4. Organizations enforcing structured design workflows


üöÄ Key Capabilities


üìã AI-Ready Export

  1. Export to YAML/JSON with full style tokens
  2. Support nested components, variants, and instances
  3. Auto-detect and optimize SVG icons
  4. Generate component preview thumbnails


üîß Fine-Tuning Metadata

  1. Add codeComponent and codeFilePath
  2. Auto-fill metadata via pattern recognition
  3. Visual tree browser with search and bulk editing


üóÉ Component Record Management

  1. Full CRUD for structured records
  2. Sync from Notion, APIs, or JSON files
  3. Filterable views with fallback thumbnails
  4. Export component registry as JSON


ü§ñ Real-Time AI Integration

  1. WebSocket-based MCP bridge for tools like Cursor AI
  2. Real-time dashboard and analytics
  3. Serve specs, manifest, and previews on-demand
  4. Auto-reconnect and error resilience


üß≠ How It Works

  1. Select Components ‚Äì from your Figma file
  2. Fine-Tune ‚Äì add mappings to your codebase (optional)
  3. Export or Connect ‚Äì structured file export or live MCP server
  4. Generate Code ‚Äì AI tools use the specs to write code that aligns with your system


üìÅ Output Structure (Simplified)

export-[timestamp]/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ screen.yaml # Main screen specs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ manifest.yaml # File manifest
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/ # Component specs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles/ # Design token definitions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ icons/ # SVG exports
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ previews/ # PNG previews


Example screen.yaml

# screen.yaml
screen:
id: "signup-screen-001"
name: "SignupForm"
type: "FRAME"

dimensions:
width: 375
height: 812

styleRefs:
fills:
- "@styles/fills#background-default"
typography:
- "@styles/typography#body-normal"

children:
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#username-field-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#email-field-002"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#password-field-003"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/Button#signup-button-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextLink#login-link-001"


This defines a form-based screen layout with multiple input fields, a button, and a link‚Äîreferencing reusable components in the design system.


üîó spex-mcp

Install the companion server to integrate with AI dev tools:

‚Üí spex-mcp on npm


üí° Why SpeX?


For Designers

  1. Reduce handoff friction
  2. Track design usage across implementations


For Developers

  1. Avoid guesswork, get exact specs
  2. Leverage AI tools with full context


For AI Tools

  1. Access structured, hierarchical data
  2. Align generated code with real-world components


SpeX is where design systems meet automation. Your components. Your rules. Real code.
plugins.tagline: Built on your real components, not generic templates.

plugins.name: PrevGen
plugins.description:
PREVGEN - MICROSTOCK PREVIEW GENERATOR

=======================================


üéØ WHAT IS PREVGEN?

PrevGen is a specialized Figma plugin designed exclusively for microstock creators who need to generate hundreds of design previews quickly and efficiently. Stop spending hours creating mockups one by one - automate your entire preview generation workflow.


‚ö° HOW IT WORKS:

1. CREATE TEMPLATE

- Design your preview template in Figma

- Use built-in templates (Freepik, Envato, DepositPhotos formats)

- Mark container layers for your designs


2. UPLOAD DESIGNS

- Drag & drop PNG, JPG, SVG files

- Auto-trim PNG transparency (optional)

- Batch process multiple files


3. CONFIGURE LAYOUT

- Choose: Horizontal, Vertical, or Grid layout

- Auto-spacing and alignment

- Fit or Fill image scaling options


4. CUSTOMIZE CONTENT

- Auto-replace text with filenames

- Apply custom colors to layers

- Bulk background color changes


5. GENERATE PREVIEWS

- Mass generate all previews instantly

- Auto-naming with prefix/suffix options

- Perfect positioning and spacing


‚ú® KEY FEATURES:

===============

- TEMPLATE SYSTEM - Built-in templates for major microstock platforms

- BATCH PROCESSING - Upload and process multiple designs at once

- AUTO LAYOUT - Smart positioning with customizable spacing

- TEXT AUTOMATION - Auto-replace text layers with design names

- COLOR MAPPING - Apply custom colors to specific layers

- PNG OPTIMIZATION - Auto-trim transparent areas

- FLEXIBLE SCALING - Fit or Fill image modes

- BULK OPERATIONS - Generate hundreds of previews in one click


üé® SUPPORTED FORMATS:

====================

- PNG (with transparency trimming)

- JPG/JPEG


üìê BUILT-IN TEMPLATES:

=====================

- Freepik: Landscape (4500√ó3000), Portrait (3000√ó4500), Square (3500√ó3500)

- Envato Elements: Main Image (2340√ó1560), Secondary (2340√ó1500)

- DepositPhotos: Landscape (4500√ó3000), Portrait (3000√ó4500), Square (3500√ó3500)


üöÄ PERFECT FOR:

===============

- Stock designers creating portfolio previews

- Microstock contributors preparing submissions

- Design agencies showcasing client work

- Freelancers building presentation materials

- Anyone needing bulk design mockups


üí° USE CASES:

=============

- Create portfolio previews for Shutterstock, Adobe Stock, Getty Images

- Generate client presentation mockups

- Build design showcase galleries

- Prepare submission previews for stock platforms

- Automate repetitive design tasks


üéØ WHO BENEFITS:

===============

- Microstock photographers and designers

- Stock content contributors

- Digital design agencies

- Freelance graphic designers

- Portfolio creators


üíù PRICING:

===========

100% FREE for microstock creators and designers

No hidden fees, no subscriptions, no limitations


üõ†Ô∏è TECHNICAL SPECS:

==================

- Works with Figma Desktop and Web

- No external dependencies

- Processes files locally (secure)

- Supports unlimited file uploads

- Auto-saves plugin settings


üìû SUPPORT & CONTACT:

====================

- Bug Reports: yasadesign.work@gmail.com


üíñ SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT:

======================

Love PrevGen? Support continued development:

PayPal


Thanks for

plugins.name: SVG Export no Fill
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to export SVG icons from Figma without the fill attribute, making it easy to modify the icon colors later. You can upload the SVG files to platforms like Elementor or use them with CSS to easily change icon colors via the interface or stylesheets.

Ideal for developers who need reusable, customizable icons that can be easily adapted in various projects.
plugins.tagline: Export SVG icons without fill for easy CSS styling

plugins.name: Import large image(s)
plugins.description:
When posting full page screenshots into FigJam, the images would be blurry and unreadable because Figma automatically reduces image sizes when the height or width is over 4096px. Not anymore!


As a workaround, this plugin

  1. slices the original image into multiple images
  2. groups the sliced images together to create one cohesive image


What makes this plugin different from the others?

  1. The ability to import multiple images at once


If you like it, buy me a beer üçª
plugins.tagline: Import large image(s) into Figma and Figjam, maintaining resolution and size.

plugins.name: Frame Manager
plugins.description:
A simple but powerful tool for organizing and fixing frames in Figma. Detect duplicates, fix naming issues, and ensure proper dimensions in your design files.

Full Description

Frame Manager helps you maintain clean and well-organized Figma files by providing essential tools for working with frames.

Key Features:

üîç Duplicate Frame Detection & Removal

Instantly find frames with identical names

Option to automatically remove duplicates while keeping one instance

Clean up messy files by eliminating redundant elements

üè∑Ô∏è Frame Name Standardization

Identify frames with non-standard naming conventions

Automatically fix frame names to follow consistent PascalCase format

Enforce naming consistency across your design system

üìè Size Optimization

Find frames with dimensions not divisible by 2

Fix frame sizes to ensure clean rendering on various displays

Find frames with non-power-of-2 dimensions for texture optimization

How It Works

Install the plugin and run it from the Plugins menu

Select the feature you need from the simple, intuitive interface

Get instant feedback as the plugin detects issues or fixes problems

Enjoy a cleaner, more organized Figma file

Perfect For

Design teams working on large files

Designers preparing assets for developers

Anyone who wants to maintain consistent naming and sizing in their designs

Technical Details

Lightweight and fast - analyzes your file without lag

Non-destructive - always gives you control over changes

Works with any Figma file containing frames

Maintain better design hygiene and save hours of manual cleanup with Frame Manager!


2025 - WildCard Studios - Art Department
plugins.tagline: Clean & organize frames: find duplicates, fix names, proper dimensions with one-click solutions.

plugins.name: Conjure - AI based text generator
plugins.description:
Introduction


Use your OpenAI API key with this plugin to quickly generate text for your designs. The plugin can allows to generate multiple text layers based on the content. Furthermore, it can also group the layers by their names, allowing you to use the layer names in the prompt to further elaborate how you want the data to be filled in.


How to use


The plugin was primarily created for 2 use cases:


1. Generate variations of a single type of data:

  1. Select all the text layers that show the same type of data and you want to generate variations of it. Imagine Name, City, Stock price, etc.
  2. Make sure 'Group by layer name' is OFF.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!



2. Generate variations of multiple types of data:

  1. Select all the frames or components that you want to fill using this plugin.
  2. Turn ON 'Group by layer name'. The plugin will show you the layer names found.
  3. Add details to the prompt to explain the type of content you want to be generated for the selected fields. You can use the layer names to add specific context. Giving examples and formatting is also helpful.
  4. Click generate and it will fill the information!


3. Generated related data

You can use the group by layer name to select singular text layers which are related. An example is when you need text for First name, Last name, DoB, role, location and relatives. The plugin will try to generate related content for these layers.


Note


1. This plugin needs an OpenAI API Key to work.

2. I will recommend naming your text layers appropriately if you plan to use the Group by layer name feature. You can use it without naming the layers, but sometimes this might result in unexpected results.
plugins.tagline: OpenAI powered text generator with batch text generation feature

plugins.name: Swift Layer Exporter
plugins.description:
Manage the layers you want to export based on their name. Just add the file type extension (.jpg, .png, .svg, .pdf) to any layer. With the plugin open select any layer or any parent and all of the tagged layers will automatically be found to export.


You can also set the export scale by adding a percent 200% after the extension. You can also set the layer cropping to its native bounding box with the tag = or to the base frame with #.


  1. button.png # 200% - exports the layer button as a png at 200% in the size of the layout base frame.
  2. button.svg = 100% - exports the layer button as a svg at 100% in the size of the layer.
plugins.tagline: Manage export layers by name

plugins.name: Figma Instance Mode
plugins.description:
Inspired by this post: Please add an "Instance Selection" mode - Share an idea - Figma Community Forum


üî∂ Introducing Figma Instance Mode


- ‚§¥Ô∏è Select Instance

- ‚úÖ Instance Mode On

- üö´ Instance Mode Off


‚§¥Ô∏è Select Instance


check if there is a parent or ancestor instance with your selection, and then will redirect your selection to the instance


It is the same as the official feature named `select instance`, but with this plugin you can blind a hotkey to this feature.


‚úÖ Instance Mode On


Once you run this command, every time when you change your selection in Figma will run the `‚§¥Ô∏è Select Instance` command automatically which means you will always select the instance if your selection is within a instance.


And there will be a inspect window to show the program running result, you can get information with it.


üö´ Instance Mode Off


This feature is to turn off the instance mode, and close the inspect window


üî∂ How to add GLOBAL SHORTCUT in MacOS


Check the tutorial: Custom-shortcuts-in-figma by Jussi Virtanen


MacOS Global Shortcut Path:


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->‚§¥Ô∏è Select Instance


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->‚úÖ Instance Mode On


Plugins->Saved plugins->Figma Instance Mode->üö´ Instance Mode Off

plugins.name: Unidup
plugins.description:
Create a design set template that includes component usage and color schemes. With this plugin, you can duplicate your template to a new page, automatically apply new instances of the original component's new variants under consistent layers, and create brand new color schemes.


Additionally, color schemes can be exported in JSON format.



Document Preparation


Document Structure: Prepare the design drafts of the design scheme, which should include "Components Page" and "Template Page", as well as "Color Scheme".


Naming: Each reuse of the design scheme should have a unique name, let's tentatively call it "NAME". This naming is very important as it runs through the entire reuse process.


Template Page: The "Template Page" is the page of your design scheme, and its name should be called NAME. It will play a big role in subsequent work, transforming into various new outputs and serving various new purposes. Therefore, each artboard should contain instances of components for reuse.


Components Page: Each time the design scheme is reused, the output should be unique. The "Components Page" contains unique elements in each set of outputs, and each component should include variants, with the key of the variant being "name" and the value being NAME, to correspond with each set of outputs.


Color Scheme: The naming method for local color schemes in figma is xxx/xxx. When naming, please follow the structure NAME/color1, NAME/color2.



How to Use


Duplicate and Export JSON are two main functions.


Duplicate:

There are three cards in the interface, namely "Components Page", "From Template", and "New Page Naming".


  1. Select your "Components Page", click the "Apply Selected Page" button to the right of "Components Page", and the card will display the details of the "Components Page".
  2. Select your "Template Page", click the "Apply Selected Page" button to the right of "From template", and the card will display the details of the "Template Page".
  3. In the "New Page Naming" card, name your new output.
  4. Click the "Duplicate" button, and you have extended a new output from the "Template Page". Modify the associated components and color scheme, and this output is ready.



Export JSON:

It will list the NAME of all your output schemes, click to export the rgba color values, and download the json to your local.




See usage demo file:

https://www.figma.com/file/jUg3U53QSIzWBEn0RfUdB0/
plugins.tagline: Unidup - An easy way to reuse your design set

plugins.name: 10x HTML | Design to clean responsive code 10x faster
plugins.description:
‚ö°Ô∏è Instantly turn your Figma design into clean, responsive HTML / CSS / SCSS

üöÄ No registration, no paywall, click and get your code

üîç Preview / inspect the generated code in Figma

‚ö°Ô∏è Test responsiveness and make live adjustments

üéì Smart layout and naming



Who is it for ?


  1. Beginner looking to turn a design into a website starting from a clean structure where 90% of the work is already handled


  1. Advanced front-end developers looking to drastically speed up their workflow without compromising on the structure and readability of their code.


No registration required - run the plugin, select a frame and preview the result in a single click.

Works in both Design mode and Dev mode.



What is 10x HTML ?


Most design-to-code tools generate bloated or messy output, with non optimized layout.

That‚Äôs because extracting logic from a visual design ‚Äî especially an unstructured one ‚Äî is a hard problem..


10x HTML was built from the ground up with the clear goal of solving those issues with smart rules and layout inference.


We focus on :

- Understanding layout intent

- Reducing unnecessary nesting

- Recognizing repeated patterns (even copy-pasted ones)

- Grouping elements intelligently

- and more...


10x HTML doesn't claim to replace a frontend developer ‚Äî but it dramatically accelerates your workflow by giving you clean, factorized and structured code that you can build on.


Whether you're a beginner or an experienced front-end developer, 10xHTML is designed to handle most of the heavy lifting for you‚Äîmaking smart assumptions when needed and delivering perfect code with clear naming and structure that‚Äôs easy to build upon.


Clean, semantic code ‚Äì without the mess

- Converts buttons, inputs, headers, and more into proper HTML elements

- Uses a smart class system: base classes, modifiers, and utilities based on context

- Picks optimized class names

- Flattens overly nested layers


Smart, responsive export

- Fully responsive by default ‚Äî includes media and container queries

- Detects and links similar elements, even without components

- Intelligently groups and infers layout, even from unstructured designs


Live code and layout inspection

- Preview the final webpage right in Figma

- Test responsiveness

- Do live update to adjust the code

- Download the code and get ready for production


How to reach out ?

üí¨ Request support here

üí° Suggest an improvement here

üï∑ Report a bug here

üöÄ Join our Discord for support, feedback or questions..


‚ö†Ô∏è Note :

10x HTML is currently free and fully accessible as a Beta version.

We are trying to gather as much feedback as possible, so please feel free to post any kind of comments (bug report, idea, opinion...)

Once we reach the level of maturity we‚Äôre aiming for, we will switch to a paid model

(with very reasonable pricing)

Most design-to-code tools generate bloated or messy output, with non optimized layout.

That‚Äôs because extracting logic from a visual design ‚Äî especially an unstructured one ‚Äî is a hard problem..


10x HTML was built from the ground up with the clear goal of solving those issues with smart rules and layout inference.


We focus on :

- Understanding layout intent

- Reducing unnecessary nesting

- Recognizing repeated patterns (even copy-pasted ones)

- Grouping elements intelligently

- and more...


10x HTML doesn't claim to replace a frontend developer ‚Äî but it dramatically accelerates your workflow by giving you clean, factorized and structured code that you can build on.


Whether you're a beginner or an experienced front-end developer, 10xHTML is designed to handle most of the heavy lifting for you‚Äîmaking smart assumptions when needed and delivering perfect code with clear naming and structure that‚Äôs easy to build upon.


Clean, semantic code ‚Äì without the mess

- Converts buttons, inputs, headers, and more into proper HTML elements

- Uses a smart class system: base classes, modifiers, and utilities based on context

- Picks optimized class names

- Flattens overly nested layers


Smart, responsive export

- Fully responsive by default ‚Äî includes media and container queries

- Detects and links similar elements, even without components

- Intelligently groups and infers layout, even from unstructured designs


Live code and layout inspection

- Preview the final webpage right in Figma

- Test responsiveness

- Do live update to adjust the code

- Download the code and get ready for production


How to reach out ?

üí¨ Request support here

üí° Suggest an improvement here

üï∑ Report a bug here

üöÄ Join our Discord for support, feedback or questions..


‚ö†Ô∏è Note :

10x HTML is currently free and fully accessible as a Beta version.

We are trying to gather as much feedback as possible, so please feel free to post any kind of comments (bug report, idea, opinion...)

Once we reach the level of maturity we‚Äôre aiming for, we will switch to a paid model

(with very reasonable pricing)

plugins.name: Link Spacing & Radius Variables (Alpha)
plugins.description:
One-click application of variables to selected objects


Important: Variable Requirements

1. Variables must be in an external library (local variables are not supported yet)

2. The library must be connected to your file


Variable Naming Requirements:

For Spacing:

- Format: `space-{number}`

- Examples: `space-4`, `space-8`, `space-16`, `space-24`

- Variable value must match the number in the name

For Radius:

- Format: `radius-{number}`

- Examples: `radius-4`, `radius-8`, `radius-16`

- Variable value must match the number in the name


Collection Requirements:

- Spacing collection must include the word "spacing" in its name

- Radius collection must include the word "radius" or "border-radius" in its name


How to Prepare Your File

1. Connect the variable library:

- Open "Team Library" menu

- Find the required library

- Enable the toggle next to the "Variables" section

2. Ensure objects are prepared:

- For spacing: objects must use Auto Layout

- For radius: objects must support the cornerRadius property


How to Use

1. Select objects you want to apply variables to

2. Launch the plugin

3. Choose the desired collection from the dropdown (marked with üìö icon)

4. Click "Apply spacing" or "Apply radius"
plugins.tagline: Link spacing and radius variables

plugins.name: Text binder for AI
plugins.description:
Text Binder for AI

A LLM-optimized plugin that lets you enhance text content with AI while preserving your Figma designs. Built with AI guardrails, this plugin safely extracts, processes, and updates text across multiple frames without breaking layouts or losing design fidelity.


‚ú® Key Features

üéØ AI-Ready Content Extraction

  1. Extract text with reference tags for LLM processing
  2. Maintain exact positioning and styling information
  3. Process multiple frames simultaneously
  4. Built-in prompts and guardrails for AI safety


üîÑ Validated Content Updates

  1. Preview AI-generated changes before applying
  2. Intelligent length validation for layout preservation
  3. Real-time status checks for each text element
  4. Clear warnings for potential layout impacts


üöÄ Getting Started

  1. Select your target frames
  2. Extract text with AI-friendly reference tags
  3. Use any LLM while maintaining the safety tags
  4. Review changes with automatic validation
  5. Apply updates with confidence
